column4: can someone tell me why.... my Ubuntu guest OS won't install on VMWare Server... its having issues finding hardware for the CD-ROM drive as it progresses through the install... It starts the install but when you set the keyboard layout after that it goes to Detect hardwrae for CD-ROM and it just stalls.
hey you can get already pre-built Vmware images of ubuntu
and what is you computer spces
Shadow ya i'm d/ling one now
but i didn't wanna have to go off of an image to get it done...
use !pastebin
as i got win2k3 installed as a guest image
whatd does that do?
where do i do !pastebin at?
> !pastebin
oh ok
or if you want to we can get u setup using your real hardware
wow pastebin does me no good
i don't even know what pastebin is even for....
pastebin is a site to allow to post multi-line text without flooding the room
ohhhhhhh
it's very handy when you are needing help with ubuntu interworkings

well i wish i could show you the text of whats going on lol but this is during the ubuntu install... I've set VMWare to automatically detect CD-ROM drive. and i'm using SCSI drive 0:0 for the install... Which worked for Win2k3 but not for any linux distro
makes sense :) now i know! haha
well I would suggest u use your real hardware and make a partition( laptop) or get another Hard Drive (desktop)
shouldn't have to do this.... The whole point of a beefy server is to serve VPC's
